"Yes, it's the item you dropped before the school festival. It looks like an ordinary brooch, but it's actually a splendid magical tool with a magic formula embedded inside… How is it that you, who is treated so poorly by the House of Kerbeck, have such an expensive item?"
"W-Well, that's… it's not that big of a deal…"
After all, it was just a cheap brooch bought from a street stall, with an auxiliary spell cast on it in about thirty minutes. [TL: Damn girl, you just broke Louis' barrier he created with great effort in roughly 5 minutes, but the brooch you spent six times more time creating is still not a big deal?]
However, Bridget snorted at Monica's words.
"I had my servants analyze it, and it's not something anyone can do, to incorporate such a high-performance defensive enchantment into such a cheap brooch. This is an extremely expensive magical tool…"
"Wh-What?"
Monica was unaware that her skills as one of the Seven Sages were far surpassed those of other magicians. What's more, she didn't normally come into contact with magical tools, so she was somewhat ignorant of their value. This had completely backfired on her.
"Why do you, who is treated so poorly by the Kelbeck Counts, possess such an expensive magical tool?"
I'm sorry, that's not true, it only took me thirty minutes to make it…!
Unable to answer honestly, Monica's gaze wandered, and Bridget pressed further.
"I've always wondered why a girl like you, who seems so out of place at Serendia Academy, is always around His Highness. So I thought, could it be that you're His Highness's chosen bodyguard? If that were the case, it would explain why a girl like you was suddenly appointed to the student council, and why you have a magical tool with a defensive enchantment."
However, Bridget didn't seem convinced by her own reasoning. Bridget squinted her amber eyes and put a finger to her temple.
"…But if you were the bodyguard chosen by His Highness, that would mean that the House of Kerbeck is connected to His Highness… that's just too unnatural. The Count of Kerbeck is the most powerful military force in the eastern region… Even His Highness… Even Duke Crockford wouldn't be able to easily ask for their cooperation."
Bridget's words left Monica inwardly shocked.
N-No way, I have never thought that the House of Kerbeck is that powerful…!
"By the way, I heard that you were taken from the monastery by the wife of the former Count Kerbeck… Clarissa Norton, is that right?"
What Bridget meant was the "Monica Norton" setting that Louis Miller had come up with. It wasn't something she was hiding, and indeed, if someone asked her, that was how she would answer…
But I didn't even know the wife of the former Count's name… Why does she know so much?
Sensing Monica's wariness, Bridget smiled.
"What's the name of the monastery you were at?"
"…Huh?"
"If you lived there since you were a child, you wouldn't have forgotten, would you?"
It wasn't that she didn't remember, it was more that she hadn't thought of such a detailed setting.
As Monica hesitated, Bridget continued speaking, still smiling.
"I had all the records of the monasteries in the Kerbeck territory investigated during the winter break. However, there was no record of a girl named Monica."
It was at this point that Monica finally realized.
The one who had been sniffing around Kerbeck County during the winter break was Bridget's subordinate.
"And so I have concluded that you must be a ‘spy sent by the House of Kerbeck.' The House of Kerbeck must want to know something about His Highness Felix. That's why you came to Serendia Academy… Am I wrong?"
As Bridget pressed her for an answer, Monica struggled to find the right words to respond.
Bridget was almost certain that Monica Norton's existence was fabricated. However, she had not yet realized that Monica was the ‘Silent Witch.'
……What would Louis do in a situation like this?
Monica thought of the most cunning and skilled negotiator she knew.
——"The basics of negotiation start with understanding the other party's demands. First, you must figure out what they want."
If she continued at this rate, she would be swept away by Bridget's momentum.
Monica swallowed hard and steeled herself before finally speaking.
"Your objective, Miss Bridget, what might it be?"
In truth, Monica had hoped to approach the subject in a more roundabout manner, but this was the best she could manage.
Bridget frowned in displeasure, her gaze fixed on Monica.
"How impertinent of you to return a question with a question."
"You brought me here for a reason… didn't you? You must have something… you want me to do…"
As she spoke, Monica looked straight at Bridget, though inwardly she was thinking, ‘I wish I could look away. She's so scary…'
They held each other's gaze for several tens of seconds before Bridget finally looked away.
"To put it bluntly, I couldn't care less about your true identity. I only investigated because it might prove useful as leverage."
"Huh?"
"I have but one goal: to uncover a certain ‘secret' of His Highness. To that end, I require your cooperation, Monica Norton."
Monica was taken aback by this unexpected turn of events.
"The prince's secret? What… what do you mean?"
"I'll tell you once you've sworn to assist me."
Monica was confused.
What secret of Felix's could Bridget possibly be after?
To be honest, there were many things about Felix that puzzled Monica, so she couldn't deny her curiosity.
However, she couldn't simply agree without careful consideration. After all, she was tasked with protecting Felix.
"I-If I don't cooperate… you'll expose… my true identity… i-is that it?"
"If I could do that, it would be simple. But to be perfectly honest, I don't have the power to make enemies of the House of Kerbeck. This matter has nothing to do with my House of Sheilbury. It's something I wish to know for purely personal reasons."
It was only now that Monica understood why Louis had sought the cooperation of the House of Kerbeck for this mission.
The Kerbecks were not merely a family of flamboyant actors. They were a formidable noble house that even the likes of Duke Crockford and Marquis Sheilbury hesitated to cross.
Monica was reminded once again that not all counts were necessarily inferior to dukes or marquises.
Lady Bridget is acting solely out of personal interest, so she doesn't want to antagonize the House of Kerbeck… If I pretend to be acting on their orders, maybe I can get out of this…
Just as Monica began to entertain a glimmer of hope that she might be able to extricate herself from this predicament, Bridget spoke, her eyes on Monica's left hand.
"His Highness is currently searching for a petite young lady with an injured left hand. And you've been hiding that fact, haven't you? Or am I mistaken?"
Caught off guard, Monica's shoulders twitched, and Bridget immediately pressed on.
"I don't know what this ‘young lady with an injured left hand' signifies or why His Highness is looking for her, but you clearly wish to keep it a secret from him, don't you?"
"That's… that's…"
As Monica stammered, Bridget raised a single finger and pointed it sharply at her.
"One week."
"Huh?"
"I'll give you one week to convince His Highness to abandon his search for this ‘young lady with an injured left hand.' In return, you will cooperate with me."
Faced with this sudden exchange of conditions, Monica could only feel bewildered. But if she refused and Felix learned that ‘Monica Norton' had an injured left hand, it would be the end of her. So, she cautiously asked, "…Can you really do that?"
"Who do you take me for? In the realm of social intrigue, few can match my prowess."
With those words, Bridget used the tip of her folded fan to lift Monica's chin and smiled charmingly.

chapters.title: Book 13: Chapter 2: Please Refrain from Drinking Alcohol in the Infirmary
chapters.content:
The symptoms of mana exhaustion are said to be similar to anemia. Your whole body gets cold, your head feels heavy, and you have no strength in your body.
Glenn, who has more mana than most people, has rarely experienced mana exhaustion. However, there was one time when he clearly ran out of mana and collapsed just like now. That was when he lost control of his magic in Minerva.
That time too, it was a magic duel with Hubert… No, what happened that time can't be called a magic duel. Glenn could do nothing but run away.
The current Glenn is different from that time… but in the end, he lost again.
It's frustrating…
For Monica's sake, he had to win this fight.
"……I wonder what happened to the outcome of the duel."
As Glenn stirs in bed, a familiar voice comes from above.
"It was a draw."
Glenn jolts up in bed in shock.
Sitting by the bedside, nibbling on dried meat and sipping from a wine bottle, is his mentor, Louis Miller.
"Why are you here, Master!?"
"Who do you think has been maintaining the barrier for this magic duel?"
Apparently, Louis was asked by his teacher, MacLegan, to come all the way here to maintain the barrier for the magic duel. In other words, Louis had seen all of Glenn's disgrace. Glenn dejectedly slumps his shoulders and looks up at Louis with a sidelong glance.
"I lost to that guy again…"
In front of his depressed disciple, Louis briefly chants a spell and lights a fire at his fingertips. While lightly roasting the dried meat, Louis says in a casual tone, as if it were an afterthought.
"Last time, it was just a brat who took life for granted and lost control of his magic. This time, it was a pure defeat after giving it your all. Make sure you understand the difference. Otherwise, you'll miss the point of reflecting on your mistakes."
"Yes…"
"It wasn't bad that you held back and didn't use the pursuit technique from the beginning. You've grown, haven't you?"
Louis extinguished the fire at his fingertips and thrust the sizzling dried meat into Glenn's mouth. Apparently, this dried meat was a gift for Glenn's visit. Glenn chews on the dried meat, secretly thinking that it's strange for Louis to be using it as a snack for his wine.
"By the way, what do you mean by a draw?"
"The magic tool that Hubert Dee brought with him malfunctioned. This magic duel is a draw."
For the time being, it seems that there is no need to worry about Monica being taken away by Hubert right away. Glenn, who had been concerned about his friend, breathed a sigh of relief and chewed on the dried meat. After all, there's nothing like meat when you're tired.
"Ah, that's good… Monica was going to be taken away by that senior because of my loss, you see. Oh, Monica is my friend."
"Oh?"
Glenn, unaware that Louis was inwardly clicking his tongue at the thought of what that incompetent witch had done this time, looked at the wine bottle that his mentor was holding in one hand.
"By the way, Master… I don't think it's a good idea to bring alcohol into the infirmary."
"Aren't rubbing alcohol and drinking alcohol both alcohol?"
"If you said that in front of Mrs. Rosalie, you'd definitely get scolded." (TL: She's Louis' wife)
＊ ＊ ＊
"Mmm, mm, mm, mmm~"
Despite having run out of magic once, Hubert walked down the hallway with his usual attitude, his hands in his pockets.
In this magic duel, Hubert's magic tool had malfunctioned, and he had insisted that it was a lie. As a result, Hubert's reputation had plummeted, but he didn't seem to care. He was the type of person who was indifferent to the opinions of others.
Above all, he was in an extremely good mood.
The prey he had been chasing after a few years ago was still alive… No, she had become even stronger than before.
Who would have thought that she would jump into the hunting ground on her own?
When Monica was in Minerva, she had always run away from Hubert, crying and sobbing. And now, that same Monica had willingly jumped into the magic duel and confronted him! What's more, she had directed her anger at Hubert!
Ahh, that's great… That cold, expressionless face of hers, it's so tempting every time I remember it.
Thinking back, when Monica was in Minerva, she had always been alone, holed up in her laboratory, and had never tried to interact with anyone other than her teachers.
But now, Monica was surrounded by friends. She was attached to a place called the Student Council. That attachment was what drove Monica.
If I were to completely destroy the things she's attached to… Ahh, I wonder if I'll be able to see that merciless, cruel queen again. I'd like to try destroying one of them right in front of Monica's eyes.
For example, the man standing in front of him right now, Cyril Ashley.
"Stop, Hubert Dee."
With those words, Cyril began a shortened incantation.
An ice arrow was precisely aimed at Hubert's forehead. Despite the fact that the magic duel had just ended and he must have hardly any magic left, Cyril had already recovered enough to use magic.
Thinking that he was quite impressive, Hubert smirked.
"Mmm mmm mmm~, don't worry, I won't force Monica to do anything."
"You're not trustworthy."
"Seriously… For now."
Once he was ready to hunt again, he could destroy this man in front of Monica as an example. Alternatively, it might not be a bad idea to obediently follow that merciless queen and wait for an opportunity to sink his teeth into her throat.
Ahh, this is fun. I thought Serendia Academy was a stuck-up school and that it would be boring, but now there are so many fun things to do.
Cyril watched Hubert, who was grinning, with a look of disgust, but then he muttered something.
"Do you know something… about the Silent Witch?"
"Mmm mmm mmm~, what are you talking about?"
"In the middle of that fog… I heard you blurted out the name of the Silent Witch."
I see. This man, who recovered quickly, must have remained conscious during the magic duel.
Even so, it seems that he hasn't reached the conclusion that the Silent Witch is Monica Norton.
Hubert approached Cyril, bent down his waist to look into his face, and said,
"Obviously, it's a s-e-c-r-e-t. If you want to find out, let's have another magic duel."
"You're sickening. Don't get so close to my face."
As Cyril wrinkled his nose and groaned, Hubert doubled over with laughter.
She may not be as good as Monica, but this man seems like he could be a good plaything as well.
＊ ＊ ＊
Freed from Bridget, Monica returned to her attic room and immediately collapsed onto her bed.
"Nero…"
When she called out to Nero, who was sleeping in the basket by her pillow, she heard a happy, meowing snore in response. It was a snore that was hard to believe came from a dragon.
"Lady Bridget found out about a lot of things… She doesn't know that I'm the Silent Witch, though…"
Bridget seemed to think that Monica was a "spy for the House of Kerbeck."
However, it was true that Bridget had discovered that Monica was not an ordinary person. Above all, she had learned about her left-hand injury.
"What does Lady Bridget want me to do for her…?"
Bridget had said that there was a "secret about His Highness" that she absolutely had to know. And she wanted Monica to help her with that.
I'm also curious about His Highness' secret, though…
Why does he obey the Duke of Crockford?
Does he know that the Duke of Crockford is involved in the Cursed Dragon incident?
Does Felix know that the Duke of Crockford may have been involved in the death of Monica's father?
There were too many questions to count.
Should I tell Louis about this? No, but when it comes to His Highness's secrets… I feel like it's better not to say anything.
Louis was a man who openly declared that he disliked both the Duke of Crockford and the second prince. Moreover, he seemed to hold a grudge against Felix for breaking the magic tool he had worked so hard to create in just three days.
If Louis were to learn about Felix's secrets or weaknesses, it was obvious that he would use them with glee.
Speaking of which, Lynn hasn't come by even once since the new semester started… She used to come much more often…
Monica was wondering if she was busy because her wife, Mrs. Rosalie, was close to her due date when she heard a tapping sound on the window.
Wondering if it was Lynn, Monica turned her eyes to the window and widened her eyes. Perched on the windowsill was a black cat. It looked a lot like Nero, but this cat had only white color on its tail and the tips of its paws. A letter with a rose emblem was tied around its collar. The cat also had a small cloth bag on its back. A carrot was sticking out of the bag.
When it came to a rose emblem and vegetables, there was only one person who came to mind—the Thorn Witch, Raul Roseburg.
Monica opened the window and let the cat in, then untied the letter that was attached to it and spread it open. The letter was written in bold letters.
‘Yo, Monica, how's it going? I'm doing great!
So, listen, I invited Ray to my place the other day. We harvested vegetables together!
Ray said the sunlight was too bright and he was melting, so I told him he was like an earthworm! …When I said that, he put a curse on me that made bugs swarm me, man, I was surprised. Don't you think it would be great if we could use that curse to make something like a bug repellent? Oh, and we could also use it to gather bees to pollinate fruits.
I'll have my familiar bring you some of the vegetables I harvested with Ray. The cabbages came out really well this year, and I really wanted you to try them, but my familiar can't carry cabbages, so I brought you carrots instead.
Come visit me sometime, Monica. I'll make you some of my special cabbage soup!
Oh, by the way, the Sheffield festival is coming up soon, right? Around that time, I'm going to be working on replanting the Duke of Crockford's garden.
Isn't this a chance to infiltrate the Duke of Crockford's mansion and expose his evil deeds?
Ray says he's sick of gardening and won't go, but will you come, Monica?
I'll bring a few of my servants with me when I go to replant, so if you blend in with them, I think you can infiltrate without revealing your identity.
Let's go undercover together!
From the Thorn Witch, Raul Rosenberg'
Just like that, she had been invited to go on an undercover mission as if she were being invited to a party. But this was a chance to investigate the Duke of Crockford.
The Sheffield festival mentioned in the letter was exactly one month from now, a day to celebrate the Wind Spirit King bringing the winds of spring. Serendia Academy would also be closed for three days, including that day.
After reading the letter once more, Monica sat down at her writing desk and wrote a reply, asking to be taken along on the undercover mission.

chapters.title: Chapter 163: C13V4: My First Charming Prince
chapters.content:
Bridget brought Monica to the most luxurious private tea room at Serendia Academy.
The table was already set with dishes, so Bridget must have prepared this room in advance… in other words, she had no intention of letting Monica escape.
A maid accompanied Bridget in the room, but after pouring tea into their cups, she left without saying anything. Now they were alone in the room.
"Please enjoy the tea first. It's the first harvest of Florendia."
"Um, Lady Bridget, what is the ‘secret of His Highness' that you want to know? What do you want me to help with?"
When Monica asked directly, Bridget took a sip of tea and sighed.
"It's a vulgar way of speaking to get to the point without preamble. It lacks refinement."
Saying that, Brigitte looked at the flowers arranged in a vase. Monica followed her gaze and looked at the flowers too.
The flowers were yellow roses with delicate petals like lace. It was not something easily obtainable this season.
Monica had learned in the past six months that the sense and wealth of the host were judged by the flowers and tea utensils arranged at the tea ceremony.
"Let's enjoy the tea party by admiring the flowers and teacups, and enjoying black tea, while you listen to my story."
Monica, who was not good at indirect expressions and probing, wanted her to get to the point quickly, but it seemed that Bridget had something on her mind.
As Monica silently took a sip of tea, Bridget smiled lightly and spoke.
"What do you think of Prince Felix?"
"Huh?"
Monica let out a dumbfounded voice at the sudden question. If it were Monica from a while ago, she would have answered, "I think he's amazing with his face and body in perfect proportion." But now, Monica had too many thoughts about Felix and couldn't put them into words.
"To be honest, I don't really know."
At first glance, Felix was a charming prince who was well-liked and capable. But everyone knows that he is a puppet of Duke Crockford. Furthermore, Monica knows that he used to call himself "Eig" and secretly engage in night activities and that he is a big fan of the Silent Witch.
…There are too many different sides to him, and Monica doesn't know which one is the real him.
Bridget responded to Monica's ambiguous answer with a short "I see," and her gaze fell to the cup in her hand.
"If you had said that he is a perfect prince who is good at studying, sports, popular with people, and skilled in conversation, this conversation would have ended here, and I wouldn't have asked for your help."
"Huh?"
When Monica looked at her with a surprised face, Bridget closed her eyes for a moment and then slowly opened them.
"He is frail, a crybaby, not good at studying or sports, below average in everything he does. Above all, he is extremely shy and timid in front of others."
Could it be that she is talking about herself… Monica wondered, and Bridget continued.
"…That's the Felix I know."
For a moment, Monica couldn't understand the meaning of those words.
Felix is below average in everything he does? Not good at speaking in front of others?
Monica couldn't hide her confusion, and Bridget started speaking with a slightly distant look in her eyes.
"I first met His Highness when I was seven years old. My first impression of him was that he was ‘unreliable and unsightly.' He could barely greet me. He couldn't look me in the eye. He just kept looking down and fidgeting."
Bridget's story sounded more and more like Monica's herself. It didn't feel like she was talking about Felix at all.
"He worked harder than anyone in his studies and sports. Yet, he couldn't reach the level of an average person. He would cry and say, ‘I'm sorry for not meeting expectations even though I'm a royal…' He was really timid, weak, and uncool… but… he was kinder than anyone."
When Bridget uttered the last words, her perfectly beautiful face seemed slightly tinged with sadness. Just by looking at her face, one could easily imagine the feelings she had for Felix.
"I thought no one believed he could become king. I thought so too. But… I thought he would be the one I wanted to be with, even if he couldn't become king."
It was her first love, and her voice murmured softly, tinged with a hint of loneliness.
When you see her face, you can easily imagine the feelings she had for Felix.
"Everyone simply assumed he wouldn't make it as king. I also thought so. But… somehow, I knew he was the one I wanted to spend my life with."

That's why Bridget, upon hearing that Felix had a serious illness, was extremely worried.
She spent over a year in anxiety without even being allowed to visit him…
"I was so relieved when His Highness's illness finally recovered. But when I went to see him… he had changed into a completely different person."

The boy in front of her was undoubtedly Felix Ark Ridill. He had grown taller after not seeing him for over a year, but there was no way she could mistake that face. However, Bridget felt a terrible sense of discomfort and even nausea.

that
Felix.

chapters.title: Book 13: Chapter 5: The Smiles Showdown
chapters.content:
At that moment, Monica turned pale when Felix visited the tearoom, but Bridget didn't change her expression and greeted Felix with a bright smile.
"Oh my, it's rare for Your Highness to visit the tearoom."
"I think the rare thing is this combination. Since when did you two become so close that you're having tea together?"
"Why, we're both student council members. There's nothing strange about it, is there?"
The conversation between the handsome man and the beautiful woman, who were the pride of the academy, was a very picturesque sight.
However, Monica couldn't help but feel her palms sweating at the mind games going on behind the scenes.
Th-this is amazing…
If she were to interrupt, she might accidentally reveal something. Monica silently watched the exchange between the two.
"The student council meeting is coming up soon, isn't it? I'd like to give you a little lecture for that."
"Oh, when Monica was invited to the club president's tea party, it was decided that you would accompany her."
"Yes, we were discussing the arrangements for that."
Monica was simply impressed by Bridget's smooth excuses. If it were Monica, she would have either come up with a nonsensical excuse or hesitated and stammered.
Felix shifted his gaze from Bridget to Monica and smiled pleasantly.
"Are you prepared for dealing with the club presidents?"
"Y-yes, well, um…"
As expected, Monica hesitated, and Bridget covered her mouth with her fan and chuckled.
"Honestly, before we even get to dealing with the club presidents, there's a problem with your etiquette. Miss Norton, did you not take the tea party lessons seriously?"
Monica flinched when Bridget gave her a cold stare.
"H-h-h-how h-horrible of m-m-me…"
"I'll thoroughly teach you tea party etiquette for a while. Be prepared."
Oh, well done. Monica was impressed inwardly.
If she were told this way, it wouldn't be unnatural for Bridget to invite Monica to a tea party in the future.
Isabelle, who plays the role of the villainess, is quite a good actress, but Bridget's acting is even more natural.
In these situations, Monica can't help but be impressed by how intelligent she is. At least it's something Monica could never do.
Across from the carefree Monica, Felix was looking at Bridget with a wry smile.
"Your guidance sounds strict. How about I help out as a guest if you're practicing for a tea party?"
"We're not at a stage where we can show it to Your Highness yet. I don't like to show half-baked results."
Felix smiled gently at Bridget, who implied that he should leave.
"The most important thing in a tea party is to enjoy the conversation, isn't it? Don't you think it would be easier if you had someone to talk to?"
How many people could refuse when the student council president, who is at the top of this academy, says so with a gentle smile?
If it were Monica, she would have definitely been won over by that smile.
However, Bridget covered her mouth with her fan and giggled.
"Oh no, Your Highness. Girls' talk is supposed to be a secret from men."
"Something you can't tell me?"
"Yes, like who we're interested in."
Bridget narrowed her eyes slightly and lifted her lips seductively.
It was the kind of smile that would make most men stagger under her charm.
Th-this is amazing… It's like a sparkling smile showdown…
Monica couldn't help but wonder what a smile showdown was, but when she saw Felix and Bridget interacting, that was the word that came to her mind.
Both Felix and Bridget know how to use their beauty well.
Sandwiched between the two of them, the plain Monica could only blend into the background.
However, Felix would always give a brilliant smile even to such a background character.
"Someone you're interested in? …Monica, is there someone you're interested in?"
"Huh!?"
Monica, who was suddenly asked a question, let out a strange cry and started sweating profusely.
H-h-how should I answer this? What is "someone I'm interested in"? The person I'm most interested in right now is His Highness, who is full of secrets. There's no way I can say thaaaat!
As Monica was holding her head in her hands, Bridget smiled and chuckled.
"She was telling me about the time I first got flowers from a boy."
Bridget traced the yellow rose arranged in the vase and looked at Felix with a meaningful gaze.
"Your Highness, do you remember the color of the flower you first gave me when we were young?"
Bridget was testing Felix Ark Ridill, who was in front of her.
How would Felix respond? Would he pretend to have forgotten or…?
In front of Monica, who was holding her breath in suspense, Felix took out a white handkerchief from his pocket.
A handkerchief? What is he going to do with a handkerchief?
Felix folded the handkerchief thinly, rolled it up, and shaped it into a rose, then handed it to Bridget.
"Unfortunately, I only have a white handkerchief with me now… Ah, after all, blue suits you best."
Monica couldn't tell if this was the right or wrong answer. However, since she saw Bridget pursing her lips in regret under her fan, perhaps this was the correct answer.
Bridget immediately smiled brightly and accepted the white rose made of the handkerchief.
"Oh, you remembered? I'm glad."
"It's better made than before, isn't it?"
"Yes, it's very well made. Your Highness has always been skillful."
"Not really, I just practiced a lot when I was little."
To an outsider, it was a heartwarming conversation reminiscing about the past. However, Monica could feel the intense battle of nerves going on beneath the surface.
Bridget was deliberately bringing up their childhood, waiting for him to make a mistake.
As Monica held her breath, watching how this battle would unfold, Cyril's voice calling out to Felix came from the hallway.
"Your Highness, are you here? There's an urgent matter I need to confirm…"
Felix turned his gaze toward the door and shrugged his shoulders, looking slightly disappointed.
"I'd like to be invited to the next tea party as well."
"When Miss Norton acquires the manners of an average person, I'll be happy to."
With that exchange, Felix left the tearoom.
Listening to the sound of the door closing with a thud, Monica let out a deep breath even though she hadn't done anything.
"H-He sure is a smooth talker, as always."
Bridget crushed the rose made of a white handkerchief and muttered spitefully. Still, why is it that the angry face of a beautiful woman has such power?
"It's frustrating, but it seems that man has thoroughly investigated His Highness's childhood."
"Ah, um, if that person the real Highness, and because of an illness… or something like that, his personality changed or something like that…"
"What kind of pathogen would have to get into his head for that innocent Highness to start spreading cold words and smiles?"
"…"
It seemed that Bridget had a stronger aversion to the current Felix Ark Ridill than Monica had thought.
After a moment of hesitation, Monica opened her mouth.
"Ah, um, well. I'm planning to infiltrate the Duke of Crockford's mansion on Sheffield's festival day."
"What did you say?"
"…If you know anything about the inside of the Duke of Crockford's mansion, Lady Bridget, could you tell me?"
If, as Bridget had deduced, the real Prince Felix was in the Duke of Crockford's mansion, then the more information they had about the inside of the mansion, the better.
That was the intention behind her suggestion, but Bridget pressed Monica and said something unexpected.
"Take me with you."
"Wha…?"
"I'm saying that I will also infiltrate the Duke of Crockford's mansion."
"Eh, whaaaat!?"
Monica almost fell out of her chair.
This lady, who seemed like the epitome of a sheltered young lady, would infiltrate on her own? That was ridiculous.
"Ah, ah, um, the infiltration is, well, we're going to blend in as gardeners, so Lady Bridget…"
"If I can meet the real His Highness, I don't care if I have to pretend to be a gardener, a groom, or a traveling performer."
Even after that, Monica tried to persuade Bridget with all her might, even though her words were clumsy. However, she was unable to persuade Bridget, who had made up her mind to meet the real prince.
On that day, Monica learned firsthand just how terrifying the power of a girl in love can be.
